metadata.name: Story Elements Expansion
metadata.description: Elements extracted from the provided story analysis

character_archetypes.text: The troubled Queen with a shadow on her heart
The loving King who sacrifices for his Queen's happiness
The manipulative Sorcerer who offers relief at a hidden cost
The thoughtful Prince who observes and analyzes
The quiet Prince who keeps his own counsel
The loyal courtier who brings gifts and news
The wise elder who recognizes the curse's nature
The innocent subjects who suffer from another's bargain

setting_elements.text: A kingdom blessed with sunshine and prosperity
A desolate shore marking the boundary to darkness
A stark, black tower housing dark magic
A royal palace gradually losing its luster
A kingdom where colors and joy slowly fade
A court blind to the subtle changes around them
A land where shadows grow longer each day

magical_elements.text: A curse that steals joy from beautiful things
A shadow tether connecting the cursed to the curse-maker
Magic that requires a specific price for its working
A crown with gems that visibly dim when joy is stolen
A spell that brings peace at the cost of others' happiness
An invisible bond that drains energy from the kingdom
A bargain with consequences beyond the bargainer's understanding

plot_functions.text: Exposition establishing an idealized kingdom before trouble
Inciting incident of inner shadow/pain that cannot be understood
Journey to seek external solution for internal problem
Bargain with a dark force offering easy relief
Misunderstanding the true cost of the bargain
Triggering the curse through genuine appreciation of beauty
Gradual realization of the curse's true nature
Kingdom-wide suffering from one person's choice
Denial and rationalization of supernatural effects

symbolic_objects.text: A magnificent crown symbolizing unity and collective joy
Flawless gems representing pure happiness and beauty
A thin thread of shadow representing the curse's connection
Dimming lights representing the draining of joy and vitality
The black tower representing externalized darkness
The desolate shore representing the boundary between light and dark
The Sorcerer's cold eyes representing emotionless manipulation

moral_implications.text: Love involves sacrifice, even painful ones
Seeking easy solutions to internal problems leads to greater harm
Desperation can lead to rash promises with far-reaching consequences
The price of magic always exceeds its apparent cost
One person's choices can affect an entire community
Denying uncomfortable truths doesn't make them disappear
External beauty can mask internal corruption
True healing comes from within, not external sources

psychological_meanings.text: The shadow on the heart representing unresolved trauma or depression
The journey across the sea as confronting the unconscious
The Sorcerer as the externalized shadow self or tempter
The bargain representing self-destructive coping mechanisms
The dimming kingdom as collective depression or emotional contagion
The tether as the ongoing connection to past trauma
The stolen joy as emotional vampirism or energy drain
The King's denial as psychological defense mechanism

narrative_patterns.text: Classic fairy tale opening establishing an idealized world
Journey to a dark place representing internal descent
Magical bargain with hidden, terrible cost
Curse that spreads beyond the original target
Gradual darkening of the environment reflecting spiritual corruption
Moment of realization when the true nature of the bargain becomes clear
Royal family as microcosm of the kingdom's health
Symbolic object that visibly manifests the curse's effects
